db package

Submodules

db.db module

db.db.create_server_connection()[source]

Create a connection to the MySQL server.

Returns

A MySQL connection object.

Return type

mysql.connector.connect

Raises

Error – If there is an error connecting to the MySQL server.

db.db.execute_insert(connection, query)[source]

Execute an INSERT statement on the given connection.

Parameters

  • connection (mysql.connector.connect) – A MySQL connection object.

  • query (str) – The INSERT statement to be executed.

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the INSERT statement.

db.db.execute_select(connection, query)[source]

Execute a SELECT statement on the given connection and return the result.

Parameters

  • connection (mysql.connector.connect) – A MySQL connection object.

  • query (str) – The SELECT statement to be executed.

Returns

A list of tuples representing the rows returned by the SELECT statement.

Return type

list

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT statement.

db.hepers module

db.hepers.create_response(query_result)[source]

Create a response string from the given query result.

Parameters

query_result (list) – The result of a query to a MySQL database.

Returns

A string representation of the query result.

Return type

str

db.hepers.format_query_result(query_result)[source]

Formats the query result so that countries that have multiple properties, appearing on multiple lines, are reduced to a single line with all properties.

Parameters

query_result – A list of tuples, where each tuple contains a country name and a property.

Returns

A list oftuples, where each tuple contains a country name as the first element and a list of its properties.

Return type

list[tuple[str, list[str]]]

db.populate module

db.populate.populate_capitals(countries, capitals)[source]

Populate the ‘capitals’ table in the MySQL database with data from the given dictionary.

Parameters

  • countries (list) – A list of countries.

  • capitals (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing lists of capital cities.

Raises

Error – If there is an error inserting data into the ‘capitals’ table.

db.populate.populate_languages(countries, languages, table_name)[source]

Populate the given table in the MySQL database with data from the given dictionary.

Parameters

  • countries (list) – A list of countries.

  • languages (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing lists of languages.

  • table_name (str) – The name of the table to be populated.

Raises

Error – If there is an error inserting data into the given table.

db.populate.populate_neighbouring_countries(countries, neighbouring_countries)[source]

Populate the ‘neighbouring_countries’ table in the MySQL database with data from the given dictionary.

Parameters

  • countries (list) – A list of countries.

  • neighbouring_countries (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing lists of neighbouring countries.

Raises

Error – If there is an error inserting data into the ‘neighbouring_countries’ table.

db.populate.populate_states(countries, population, area, density, constitutional_form)[source]

Populate the ‘states’ table in the MySQL database with data from the given dictionaries.

Parameters

  • countries (list) – A list of countries.

  • population (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing population data.

  • area (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing area data.

  • density (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing density data.

  • constitutional_form (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing constitutional form data.

Raises

Error – If there is an error inserting data into the ‘states’ table.

db.populate.populate_time_zones(countries, time_zones)[source]

Populate the ‘time_zones’ table in the MySQL database with data from the given dictionary.

Parameters

  • countries (list) – A list of countries.

  • time_zones (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing lists of time zones.

Raises

Error – If there is an error inserting data into the ‘time_zones’ table.

db.populate.replace_None_with_NULL(data)[source]

Replace all occurrences of None in the given dictionary with the string ‘NULL’.

Parameters

data (dict) – A dictionary with keys representing countries and values representing data.

Returns

The updated dictionary.

Return type

dict

db.queries module

db.queries.get_all_by_property(property, order)[source]

Get the name and value of a property for all countries from the ‘states’ table, sorted in the specified order.

Parameters

  • property (str) – The name of the property to be retrieved.

  • order (str) – The order in which the results should be sorted. Either ‘ASC’ for ascending or ‘DESC’ for descending.

Returns

A string with the name and value of the specified property for all countries, sorted in the specified order.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_all_capitals()[source]

Get the name and capital of all countries from the ‘states’ and ‘capitals’ tables.

Returns

A string with the name and capitals of all countries.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_all_countries()[source]

Get all countries and their properties from the ‘states’ table.

Returns

A string with all countries and their properties.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_all_languages(table)[source]

Get the name and language of all countries from the ‘states’ and the given table.

Parameters

table (str) – The name of the table to be used for retrieving the language.

Returns

A string with the name and language of all countries.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

A string with the name and time zone of all countries.

Return type

str

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_countries_by_constitutional_form(constitutional_form)[source]

Get the name and constitutional form of all countries from the ‘states’ table that have the given constitutional form.

Parameters

constitutional_form (str) – The constitutional form to be used for filtering.

Returns

A string with the name and constitutional form of all countries that have the given constitutional form.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_countries_by_language(table_name, language)[source]

Get the name and language of all countries from the ‘states’ and the given table that have the given language.

Parameters

  • table_name (str) – The name of the table to be used for retrieving the language.

  • language (str) – The language to be used for filtering.

Returns

A string with the name and language of all countries that have the given language.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_countries_by_time_zone(time_zone)[source]

Get the name and time zone of all countries from the ‘states’ and ‘time_zones’ tables that have the given time zone.

Parameters

time_zone (str) – The time zone to be used for filtering.

Returns

A string with the name and time zone of all countries that have the given time zone.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_countries_with_more_than_1_capital()[source]

A string with the name and capital of all countries that have more than 1 capital.

Return type

str

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_country(country)[source]

Get the properties of the given country from the ‘states’ table.

Parameters

country (str) – The name of the country to be retrieved.

Returns

A string with the properties of the given country.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.

db.queries.get_top_10_by_property(column)[source]

Get the top 10 countries by the given property.

Parameters

column (str) – The name of the property to be used for ranking.

Returns

A string with the top 10 countries by the given property.

Return type

str

Raises

Error – If there is an error executing the SELECT query.
